newsitem.title: INDIA: DELHI SHARES DIP AHEAD OF STOCK REGULATOR MEETING.
newsitem.headline: DELHI SHARES DIP AHEAD OF STOCK REGULATOR MEETING.

text.p: Delhi share prices closed lower on Tuesday on heavy selling by speculators and institutional investors ahead of a meeting of bourse regulator, Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI), brokers said.
The Delhi Stock Exchange's sensitive index closed 14.51 points lower at 931.26.

"It seems that the major participants including foreign investors are awaiting the outcome of the SEBI board meeting before finalising their buying strategy," said Suresh Aggarwal of brokers Jai Mata Securities.
SEBI was set to hold a news conference at 5.00 p.m. (1130 GMT) in Bombay. It was expected to announce a proposed introduction of an easier carry-forward trading system, a SEBI spokesman said.
Reliance Industries closed 7.70 rupees lower at 373.50 on late selling by institutional investors, brokers said.
ITC ended 2.50 rupees lower at 576 on profit taking by speculators, brokers said.
